SENT.plain: Saethre-Chotzen, Crouzon, and Jackson-Weiss syndromes are craniosynostotic autosomal dominant conditions with a wide variability in expression
Saethre-Chotzen has been mapped to chromosome 7p by L
29: 681-685), the Greig cephalopolysyndactyly gene was identified at 7p13 by A
(1991, Nature 352: 539-540), and many cases of craniosynostosis have been associated with 7p deletions
We confirmed linkage of the Saethre-Chotzen syndrome locus to chromosome 7p
The tightest linkage was to locus D7S493 (Z = 5.04, theta = 0.00), and linkage and haplotype analyses refined the location of the gene to the region between D7S513 and D7S516

Jackson-Weiss and Crouzon syndrome loci were analyzed using markers spanning the entire 7p arm and were excluded, proving that they are nonallelic to Saethre-Chotzen, Greig cephalopolysyndactyly, and the del(7p) syndromes
